content.raw:
mm not sure what's blocking your OCU-FC connections. We use the same communication method between simulator and FC. So if you do `docker ps` in the simulation instance after starting simulation, the `PORTS` are also empty but the FC docker container is able to publish and subscribe to the simulator ROS topics over the VPN tunnel.

Here're outputs from my testing:

~~~
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-229:~/code$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
87a132af25f8        fcomputer           "/ros_entrypoint.sh ."   30 seconds ago      Up 26 seconds                           team_container
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-229:~/code$ docker exec -it team_container bash
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# 
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# ls
build  devel  do_footsteps.bash  footsteps_2017-05-02-14-40-59.bag  install  logs  src  startup.bash
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# nc -l 8003
hello
~~~

~~~
ian@ian-osrf:/tmp/ssh_tmp/client$ nc 192.168.2.10 8003
hello
~~~
content.html:
mm not sure what's blocking your OCU-FC connections. We use the same communication method between simulator and FC. So if you do docker ps in the simulation instance after starting simulation, the PORTS are also empty but the FC docker container is able to publish and subscribe to the simulator ROS topics over the VPN tunnel.

Here're outputs from my testing:

ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-229:~/code$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
87a132af25f8        fcomputer           "/ros_entrypoint.sh ."   30 seconds ago      Up 26 seconds                           team_container
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-229:~/code$ docker exec -it team_container bash
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# 
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# ls
build  devel  do_footsteps.bash  footsteps_2017-05-02-14-40-59.bag  install  logs  src  startup.bash
root@ip-172-31-24-229:/home/docker/ws# nc -l 8003
hello

ian@ian-osrf:/tmp/ssh_tmp/client$ nc 192.168.2.10 8003
hello
